result.execSummary:
The defendant Dale E. LANE was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Maintain fulltime employment, schooling or a combination of both.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Submit to random urine screens and pay for same.

Maintain absolute sobriety except for lawfully prescribed medications which are taken in prescribed doses.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.
Undergo a psychological evaluation and follow through with all recommendations.

timeConds.notes:
Ordinary confinement, commencing immediately.

Spend an additional forty-one (41) days in the county jail, Ordinary confinement, stayed and to be imposed at the agent's discretion and upon order of the court.

The two (2) days credit is only to be applied if the defendant's probation is revoked.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Notice of Case Status Change and Discharge from DOC indicating that defendant was terminated from probation effective 06-12-2016

Order To Commute Sentence.
It is hereby rodered that:
1) the sentence in this case is commuted from a term of probation for 18 months to the statutory maximum of 12 months probation.  The Clerk of Courts is hereby directed to prepare an Amended Judgment of Conviction to reflect the probation therm of 12 months.
2) This is final order.

Indicated two (2) days of sentence credit if probation is revoked.

Order for Sentence Credit.
It is hereby ordered that:
1) the defendant is granted two (2) days of sentence credit on 15 CM 112.  The Clerk of Courts is hereby directed to prepare an Amended Judgment of Conviction to reflect the sentence credit, and shall note in the comments section that this credit is only to be applied if the defendant is revoked from probation;
2) the defendant is granted two (2) days of sentene credit for the dismissed and read in case no: 15 CM 168.  The Clerk of Court is hereby directed to prepare an amended judgment of conviction for 15 CF 146 to reflect the sentence credit for this dismissed but read in case, and shall note in the comments section that this credit is only applied if the defendant is revoked from probation.

Defendant requests substitution of judge.  
Not guilty plea.  Jury Calendar.   Settlement conference with the District Attorney is set for 04-09-15 at 11:10 a.m.   
Minutes.
Philip Hoff, through Public Defender.

Attorney Pozorski moves to withdraw as counsel of record, the defendant no longer wishes to have him represent him.  Court grants the motion and adjourns the initial appearance to 03-09-15 at 1:30 p.m.   
Notice.  
Minutes.
Joseph Pozorski III, through Public Defender.
RE:  Holley Melichar, on 02-09-15.

Defendant in custody.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of burglary and obstruct officer.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 03-02-15 at 2:30 p.m. Bail is set at $1,300.00 recognizance bond with the condition that he have no assaultive contact with Holly Melichar.   Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.
